meanings.definition: The action of stopping and starting at irregular intervals.
meanings.sent1: The intermittence of the rain made it hard to plan the picnic.
meanings.sent2: The intermittence of the car engine troubled the driver on the long journey.
meanings.sent3: The intermittence of the squirrel's movements amused the children in the park.
meanings.sent4: The intermittence of the flickering streetlight created an eerie atmosphere.
meanings.sent5: The intermittence of the fireworks lit up the night sky in bursts of color.

meanings.sent1: The intermittence of the internet connection frustrated the students during the online class.
meanings.sent2: The intermittence of the power supply caused inconvenience during the storm.
meanings.sent3: The intermittence of the cat's naps puzzled its owner.
meanings.sent4: The intermittence of the traffic flow mirrored the city's chaotic rhythm.
meanings.sent5: The intermittence of the music added a unique charm to the dance performance.
